entries.meaning: An action performed in opposition to another action.

verbs.description: counteract (third-person singular simple present counteracts, present participle counteracting, simple past and past participle counteracted)

entries.meaning: To have a contrary or opposing effect or force on
examples: Another tide is raised at the same time on the opposite side of the revolving earth; which is owing to the greater centrifugal motion of that side of the earth, which counteracts the gravitation of bodies near its surface.

entries.meaning: To deliberately act in opposition to, to thwart or frustrate
examples: When people hear my American accent, they want to talk to me about Donald Trump. They want to ask me what happened, and why. But most of all, they ask me – with fear filling their voices – what they can do, as individuals, to counteract him, here, from the United Kingdom.
